1.q_string: From a particular point on the ground, the angle of elevation of the top of the building is \(60\) degrees. If the building is \(400\)-meter-high, find the distance from the same point to the foot of the building?

The angle of elevation of an unfinished building from a point \(100 m\) away from its base is \(45^{\circ}\). How much higher the tower be raised so that its angle of elevation from the same point will be \(60^{\circ}\)? Give an approximate answer?
In an \(\Delta \mathrm{ABC}, \mathrm{AB}: \mathrm{BC}=3: 1\) and \(\Delta \mathrm{ABC}\) is right-angled at B. Find the value of \(\sin C+\cot A\) ?

A sailor saw the top of a lighthouse from an angle of elevation of \(45^{\circ}\). If the lighthouse tower is \(250 \mathrm{m}\) tall then approximately how far is the sailor from the top of the lighthouse?
A ladder is kept against a wall at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the ground. The height of the wall is \(14 \mathrm{m}\). Find the length of the ladder?

From a point P on a level ground, the angle of elevation of the top tower is \(60^{\circ} .\) If the tower is \(500 \mathrm{m}\) high, the distance of point \(\mathrm{P}\) from the foot of the tower is?

Ram walked \(4 \mathrm{km}\) West of his house and then turned to South covering \(8 \mathrm{km} .\) Finally he moves \(6 \mathrm{km}\) towards East and then again \(2 \mathrm{km}\) West. How far is he from his initial position?

Suhas travelled \(15 \mathrm{km}\). towards East, then turned towards North and travelled \(15 \mathrm{km}\) and turned towards West and travelled \(15 \mathrm{km}\). How far is he from the starting point?
Lata walks \(7 \mathrm{km}\) towards North, turns to her left and walks \(9 \mathrm{km}\), again she turns to her left and walks \(7 \mathrm{km}\). How far is she from the starting point?
A man goes \(7.5 \mathrm{km}\) east from point \(\mathrm{A}\) then rotates \(1170\) degree clockwise and goes \(7.5 \mathrm{km}\). In which direction is he from starting point?

A boy goes \(60 \mathrm{km}\) south from \(\mathrm{A}\) to \(\mathrm{B}\) then goes \(20 \mathrm{km}\) east to \(\mathrm{C}\) and \(20 \mathrm{km}\) north to \(\mathrm{D}\). Another girl starts from \(\mathrm{E}\) and goes to \(\mathrm{F}\) where the distance between \(\mathrm{E}\) and \(\mathrm{F}\) is equal to the length of \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{B}\) and parallel to each other, then goes \(20 \mathrm{km}\) west to \(\mathrm{G}\) and then \(20 \mathrm{km}\) north to \(\mathrm{H}\). What is the distance between \(\mathrm{D}\) and \(\mathrm{H}\) if the distance between \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{E}\) is \(60 \mathrm{km}\) and \(\mathrm{A}\) is to the west of \(\mathrm{E}\) ?

Aman swam and cycled a total of \(400 \mathrm{km}\) in \(20\) hours. His running, swimming speeds are \(8\) and \(4 \mathrm{kmph}\) respectively. If he travelled \(40 \mathrm{km}\) while running and \(28 \mathrm{km}\) while swimming, then what is his cycling speed?

Brinda goes \(30 \mathrm{km}\) towards North from a fixed point. Then after turning to her right she goes \(30 \mathrm{km}\). After this she goes \(30 \mathrm{km}\) after turning to her right. How far and in what direction is she from the starting point?

Vijet walks \(5 \mathrm{km}\) towards South, then he walks \(3 \mathrm{km}\) turning to right. Again, he turns to his right and walks \(5 \mathrm{km}\). He then turns to his left and walks \(5 \mathrm{km}\). How far is he now from the starting point?

A person walks \(9 \mathrm{km}\) to the South. From there he walks \(5 \mathrm{km}\) to the North. After this he walks \(3 \mathrm{km}\) to the West. In which direction and how far is he now from the starting point?

After walking 6 km, I turned right and covered a distance of 2 km, then turned right and covered a distance of 10 km. In the end, I was walking towards the East. From which direction did I start my journey?

A man goes 12 km east then takes 135deg clockwise turn and moves 5km and then goes 5km south and then takes 90deg clockwise turn and goes 8km. In which direction will he be facing if he takes another 90deg turn clockwise?

Vineet goes \(20 \mathrm{km}\) north and then \(21 \mathrm{km}\) east and then takes a \(135\) degree turn clockwise and walks and reaches the starting point again. Find the thrice of the total distance travelled by him till he reaches the start point again?
Akbar asks Birbal, “If South-East becomes North, North-East becomes West and so on. What will West become”?
A car covers \(630 \mathrm{km}\) in \(20\) hours. Calculate its speed in meters/second?
At what speed a motorcycle of length 2.5 meters will overtake a bus of length 8 meters running with speed 65 km/hr in 15 seconds?

Two boats, A and B, race against each other on a river flowing at 6 km/h. Boat A defeats the boat B by 12 m when racing along the flow of the river. What is the ratio of speeds of A and B in still water if the length of the race is 36 km?
If a train runs at 40 km/h, it reaches its destination late by 11 min, but if it runs at 50 km/h, it is late by 5 min only. Find the correct time for the train to complete its journey?

A car travels from Agra to Delhi at a constant speed. If its speed were increased by 10 km/hr, it would have been taken half an hour lesser to cover the distance. It would have taken 45 minutes lesser if the speed were further increased by 10 km/hr. The distance between the two cities is?

Three friends A, B and C are standing around an equilateral triangle park in such a way that A and B are standing at the base and C is standing at the top corner. The measure of each side is 6 meters. B is standing at the south-east of C. A and B walk towards North-West and North-East respectively for 6 meters at 60-degree angle. Then B and A turn towards their left and right respectively and meet at C. What is the distance between A and B now?

A starts from Z, meets K, and after that he meets M and finally he meets D. During this, he walks in a straight line. The distance between every friend he meets increases by 5 meters. If the distance between Z and K is 20 meters, then how much total distance did he cover?
Walking at 57 of the usual speed, A student reaches his school 18 minutes late. Find the usual time taken by him to cover the distance between his school and his home?

A swimmer takes 11 minutes and 15 seconds to travel 34km upsteam and takes 7 minutes and 30 seconds to return back to its original position. Then find the ratio of the speed of the current and speed of the  swimmer in still water?
To cover a distance of 90 km in 2.5 hours what should be the average speed of the car in meters/second?

Sudesh travels six trips of equal distances. His speed on first trip was 80 km/hr and in each subsequent trip his speed was half of the previous trip.What is the average speed (in km/hr) of the man in these six trips?
